name: Adiyan
region: Wayanad region extending into the Nilgiris district
summary: A small tribal group found mainly in the Nilgiris, traditionally agricultural laborers and forest dwellers with close cultural ties to Kerala tribes.

name: Aranadan
region: Western slopes of the Nilgiris district
summary: A Malayalam-speaking tribal community known for forest-based livelihoods and shifting cultivation practices.

name: Eravallan
region: Coimbatore and Tiruppur districts (Anamalai Hills)
summary: One of the hill tribes of the Anamalai range, primarily engaged in agriculture and collection of forest produce.

name: Irular
region: Coimbatore, Erode, and Nilgiris districts
summary: A major tribal group known for snake-catching, traditional medicine, and marginal farming; Tamil-speaking with unique dialects.

name: Kadar
region: Anamalai and Valparai hills of Coimbatore district
summary: Forest dwellers and honey gatherers known for deep knowledge of the rainforest ecosystem.

name: Kammara
region: Throughout Tamil Nadu (excluding Kanyakumari district and Shenkottah taluk of Tirunelveli)
summary: A traditional blacksmith and metal-working community considered a tribal group in certain hilly areas.

name: Kanikaran, Kanikkar
region: Kanyakumari district and Shenkottah, Ambasamudram taluks of Tirunelveli district
summary: An indigenous tribe inhabiting the southern Western Ghats; primarily agriculturists and forest workers.

name: Kaniyan, Kanyan
region: Southern Tamil Nadu and parts of Tirunelveli
summary: Traditionally astrologers and temple priests among Tamil tribes; maintain distinct ritual customs.

name: Kattunayakan
region: Nilgiris, Erode, and Coimbatore districts
summary: A forest-dwelling community known for honey collection and elephant mahout traditions; speak a mix of Kannada and Malayalam dialects.

name: Kochu Velan
region: Southern Western Ghats, especially Kanyakumari and Tirunelveli
summary: A small tribal group associated with forest gathering and traditional medicine.

name: Konda Kapus
region: Northern Tamil Nadu (Dharmapuri and Salem regions)
summary: Hill agriculturalists of Telugu origin known for small-scale farming on hill slopes.

name: Kondareddis
region: Northwestern Tamil Nadu and bordering Andhra Pradesh
summary: A tribal group practicing shifting cultivation and speaking a Telugu dialect; known for their forest-dependence.

name: Koraga
region: Western border of the Nilgiris district
summary: A small tribal population originally from coastal Karnataka, engaged in basket weaving and manual labor.

name: Kota
region: Nilgiris district (excluding Kanyakumari district and Shenkottah taluk of Tirunelveli)
summary: An artisan tribe of the Nilgiris known for pottery, music, and trade relations with Toda and Badaga communities.

name: Kudiya, Melakudi
region: Western slopes of the Nilgiris and Coimbatore district
summary: A forest-dwelling tribe practicing small-scale cultivation and collecting forest produce.

name: Kurichchan
region: Nilgiris and adjoining Wayanad region
summary: Closely related to the Kurichiyas of Kerala; traditional archers and agriculturalists.

name: Kurumbas
region: The Nilgiris district
summary: One of the most ancient tribal groups in the Nilgiris; traditionally forest hunters and healers.

name: Kurumans
region: Salem, Dharmapuri, and Krishnagiri districts
summary: A semi-nomadic tribal community primarily engaged in sheep herding and dryland agriculture.

name: Maha Malasar
region: Anamalai hills of Coimbatore district
summary: Closely related to the Malasar tribe, known for deep forest habitation and honey collection.

name: Malai Arayan
region: Western Ghats bordering Kerala (Nilgiris and Coimbatore)
summary: A hill tribe practicing terrace cultivation and forest-based livelihoods; culturally similar to the Arayan tribes of Kerala.

name: Malai Pandaram
region: Tirunelveli and Kanyakumari districts
summary: A small nomadic tribe living in dense forests, known for collecting honey and herbal products.

name: Malai Vedan
region: Western Ghats of Kanyakumari district
summary: A tribal hunting community residing in hill forests; name literally means 'hill hunter.'

name: Malakkuravan
region: Southern districts of Tamil Nadu
summary: A nomadic tribe with traditional skills in animal trapping and minor forest produce collection.

name: Malasar
region: Anamalai hills in Coimbatore and Tiruppur districts
summary: Forest dwellers and honey gatherers known for spiritual traditions connected to nature.

name: Malayali
region: Dharmapuri, North Arcot, Pudukottai, Salem, South Arcot, and Tiruchirapalli districts
summary: A large hill tribe engaged in dryland farming and forestry, speaking a Tamilized form of Malayalam.

name: Malayekandi
region: Western Ghats of the Nilgiris and Coimbatore
summary: A small forest-dependent group associated with the Malayali and Kadar tribes.

name: Mannan
region: Anamalai hills and border regions of Idukki and Coimbatore
summary: A forest-dwelling tribe practicing agriculture and known for matrilineal traditions.

name: Mudugar, Muduvan
region: Anamalai and Valparai hills (Coimbatore and Tiruppur districts)
summary: Hill-dwelling tribe with a distinctive language; practice slash-and-burn cultivation and honey collection.

name: Muthuvan
region: Anamalai and Tirunelveli hills
summary: A traditional forest tribe maintaining isolation; known for agriculture and animist practices.

name: Palleyan
region: Southern hill regions of Tirunelveli and Kanyakumari
summary: A small tribal community with traditional forest-based livelihoods.

name: Palliyan
region: Madurai, Dindigul, and Tirunelveli districts
summary: One of the oldest forest-dwelling tribes; primarily hunter-gatherers and honey collectors.

name: Palliyar
region: Southern Western Ghats (Madurai and Tirunelveli)
summary: Closely related to the Palliyans; live in hill caves and depend on forest produce.

name: Paniyan
region: Nilgiris district
summary: Tribal agricultural laborers of Kerala origin, known for tea plantation work and simple customs.

name: Sholaga
region: Coimbatore and Erode districts (near Sathyamangalam forests)
summary: Forest tribe known for honey collection, herbal knowledge, and harmonious coexistence with nature.

name: Toda
region: Nilgiris district (excluding Kanyakumari district and Shenkottah taluk of Tirunelveli)
summary: A pastoral tribe famous for buffalo herding, unique barrel-shaped huts, and distinctive embroidery.

name: Uraly
region: Tirunelveli and Kanyakumari districts
summary: Hill tribe known for subsistence agriculture, forest gathering, and traditional governance systems.
